title: 110_hr4898
content: The Act may be cited as the "Best Buddies Empowerment for People with Intellectual Disabilities Act of 2007". Best Buddies is a national program dedicated to helping people with intellectual disabilities integrate into mainstream society, end social isolation, and enhance their lives through friendships and employment opportunities since 1989. Best Buddies is an international organization with programs that positively impact individuals through supported employment and one-to-one friendships in various communities and campuses. The Best Buddies High Schools program pairs students with mental retardation in one-to-one friendships with high school students. The Best Buddies e-Buddies program creates e-mail friendships between people with and without intellectual disabilities. The Act aims to support Best Buddies programs for people with intellectual disabilities, dispel negative stereotypes, and promote their gifts. The Act aims to provide assistance for Best Buddies programs for people with intellectual disabilities. The Secretary of Education may award grants to Best Buddies for education activities promoting expansion and increasing participation of individuals with intellectual disabilities. This includes designing and implementing education and outreach programs that can be integrated into classroom instruction. Appropriated funds cannot be used for direct treatment of diseases or medical conditions. The Act allows grants to Best Buddies for education activities promoting participation of individuals with intellectual disabilities. Only up to three percent of funds can be used for administrative activities. Non-Federal funds can also be utilized by Best Buddies. SEC. 4. APPLICATION AND ANNUAL REPORT. To be eligible for a grant, contract, or cooperative agreement under section 3(a), Best Buddies must submit an application with a description of activities and specific measurable goals. Additionally, as a condition for receiving funds, Best Buddies must agree to submit an annual report. Best Buddies must submit an annual report detailing progress towards meeting specific goals outlined in their application for funding under section 3(a). Authorization of appropriations for grants, contracts, or cooperative agreements under section 3(a) is set at $10,000,000 for fiscal year 2009, with additional funding as needed for the following four years. Certain provisions of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 are repealed to ensure budget neutrality.
